{"step_by_step_thinking": "Frey's syndrome, also known as gustatory sweating, is a condition that typically occurs as a result of surgery or injury to the parotid glands. These glands are a type of salivary gland, located in the cheeks over the jaw, in front of the ears. The condition is not related to the submandibular or sublingual salivary glands, or the temporomandibular joint (TMJ).", "answer_choice": "B. Parotid gland"}
